title: Jacques Bretel
text:
Jacques Bretel or Jacques Bretex (dates of birth and death unknown) was a <a href="French%20%28language%29">French language</a> "<a href="trouv%C3%A8re">trouvère</a>", best known for having written "<a href="Tournament%20of%20Chauvency">le Tournoi de Chauvency</a>".
His only known work, signed and dated in 1285, "le Tournoi de Chauvency" is a long poem of about 4,500 verses recounting the events of a <a href="Tournament%20%28medieval%29">tournament</a> held during six days of feasting given by <a href="Louis%20V%2C%20Count%20of%20Chiny">Louis V, Count of Chiny</a>, in October 1285 at <a href="Chauvency-le-Ch%C3%A2teau">Chauvency-le-Château</a>. It is without doubt a masterpiece of French Middle Ages literature and, in any case, one of the best digests of courtly art of the period. 
His origin is unknown, but "Tournoi de Chauvency" is written in <a href="Old%20French">Old French</a> combined with words in the western <a href="Lorrain%20language">Lorraine</a> dialect.
"Le Tournoi de Chauvency" is kept in a manuscript (reference: <a href="Francis%20Douce">Douce</a> 308) at the <a href="Bodleian%20Library">Bodleian Library</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Oxford">University of Oxford</a>.
